cards.title: Neurosurgical Assessment Infrastructure

Our neurosurgical suites accommodate complete shunt system validation including ventricular catheter positioning, valve function verification, and drainage assessment.

cards.title: Central Nervous System Expertise
cards.description: Validated hydrocephalus models replicate intracranial pressure dynamics and cerebrospinal fluid flow abnormalities that shunt systems address. Our team understands neural tissue biocompatibility requirements, chronic implant inflammatory responses, and device performance in central nervous system environments that neurotechnology development demands.

cards.title: Neurological Device Regulatory Success
cards.description: Successful FDA submissions across hydrocephalus shunts, dural sealants, and neuromodulation platforms demonstrate our ability to generate data that addresses reviewer expectations for neurological devices requiring comprehensive biocompatibility assessment per ISO 10993 adapted for central nervous system applications alongside chronic implant safety validation.

services.title: Hydrocephalus Shunt Validation
services.description: Cerebrospinal fluid shunt systems face unique challenges proving drainage effectiveness while preventing complications including valve malfunction, catheter obstruction, and infection risks. We evaluate shunt performance using validated hydrocephalus models that replicate elevated intracranial pressure and altered CSF dynamics requiring device intervention. Our protocols assess valve opening pressure accuracy, flow rate regulation across physiological pressure ranges, and catheter patency under chronic implantation conditions. From fixed pressure valves to programmable systems with adjustable settings, our testing addresses both 510(k) pathways demonstrating substantial equivalence to predicate shunts and PMA requirements for breakthrough technologies incorporating novel pressure regulation mechanisms requiring comprehensive safety demonstration supporting clinical applications across pediatric and adult hydrocephalus populations.

services.title: Dural Sealant Characterization
services.description: Neurosurgical sealants preventing cerebrospinal fluid leaks must demonstrate adhesion strength sufficient to withstand intracranial pressure while supporting dural healing without neurotoxic complications. We evaluate sealant performance using standardized burst pressure protocols that measure seal integrity under physiological stress conditions while tissue response studies assess biocompatibility at dural interfaces and neural tissue. Leak detection methods quantify sealing effectiveness immediately following craniotomy closure and throughout healing phases addressing both acute and chronic performance requirements. Our GLP-compliant protocols support regulatory submissions across fibrin-based, polyethylene glycol, and biological sealant platforms requiring ISO 10993 biocompatibility demonstration with additional neurotoxicity assessment per FDA neurological device guidance for dural closure applications across cranial and spinal surgical procedures.

services.title: Neuromodulation Device Assessment
services.description: Spinal cord stimulation systems require validation proving electrode array positioning accuracy translates to effective pain modulation while ensuring chronic implant safety in neural environments. We test stimulator lead placement using fluoroscopic guidance documenting epidural space navigation and electrode positioning relative to target spinal segments. Electrophysiological monitoring measures stimulation threshold parameters, current distribution patterns, and neural recruitment characteristics while chronic implantation studies assess tissue response at electrode-tissue interfaces. Our protocols evaluate both conventional tonic stimulation and burst waveform patterns across multiple electrode configurations supporting regulatory pathways for neuromodulation technologies. From paddle arrays to percutaneous leads, our testing addresses PMA requirements for Class III active implantable devices requiring comprehensive effectiveness and safety demonstration per IEC 60601 medical electrical equipment standards.
